meanings.definition: A small, fragrant, white or pink wildflower.
meanings.sent1: I picked a beautiful mayflower from the field.
meanings.sent2: The garden was filled with colorful mayflowers.
meanings.sent3: The mayflower danced in the gentle breeze.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as sweet as a mayflower in bloom.
meanings.sent5: The delicate mayflower added a touch of elegance to the meadow.

meanings.definition: A ship that transported the Pilgrims from England to America in 1620.
meanings.sent1: The mayflower carried the Pilgrims across the ocean.
meanings.sent2: The journey on the mayflower was long and challenging.
meanings.sent3: The mayflower set sail with a crew of brave adventurers.
meanings.sent4: The mayflower symbolized hope for a new beginning.
meanings.sent5: The historic voyage of the mayflower changed the course of history.

meanings.definition: A type of shrub or tree with small, fragrant flowers.
meanings.sent1: The garden was filled with the sweet scent of mayflowers.
meanings.sent2: The mayflower bush bloomed beautifully in the spring.
meanings.sent3: The mayflower tree stood tall in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The mayflower shrub attracted colorful butterflies.
meanings.sent5: The fragrance of the mayflower filled the entire neighborhood.
